gameDetails.matchup: Tampa Bay Buccaneers @ New England Patriots

keyFactors.title: Perfect Matchup Convergence
keyFactors.description: Patriots allowed league-high 7.11 targets and 6.11 receptions per game to opposing RBs. While their run defense ranked 1st (75.4 YPG), they were exploitable through the air to pass-catching backs.

keyFactors.title: Bucky Irving Absence
keyFactors.description: Irving's absence due to shoulder/foot injuries meant White would handle primary RB duties in obvious passing situations, increasing his target probability significantly.

keyFactors.title: Game Script Projection
keyFactors.description: Patriots' elite run defense would force Tampa Bay into pass-heavy approach. Baker Mayfield would need to utilize checkdowns and screens to White to sustain drives.

keyFactors.title: Value Pricing
keyFactors.description: At +102 odds, the market underpriced White's reception probability given the matchup data and Irving's absence. Line should have been closer to -130 based on pre-game circumstances.

riskFactors: White's reception average (3.2) slightly below line
Potential for Tampa Bay to establish run game despite poor matchup
Patriots' defensive game plan could limit RB targets overall

quarterBreakdown.description: Patriots took early control with 166 rushing yards total. White caught 2 early targets as Tampa Bay fell behind. Mayfield attempted 21 first-half passes as run game stalled.
Patriots scored back-to-back touchdowns building 21-10 lead. White's role as pass-catching back expanded as Buccaneers chased points. Caught 2 more targets in quarter.
Trailing 28-16, Tampa Bay went pass-heavy. Mayfield threw 22 fourth-quarter passes (43 total game). White's final reception came as Bucs tried comeback. Cleared 3.5 with room to spare.

gameResults.whenCleared: Early Q4 (4th reception), finished with comfortable 5-for-5
gameResults.gamePace: Patriots dominated time of possession. Mayfield threw 43 passes completing 28 for 273 yards and 3 TDs. White's 100% catch rate on 5 targets validated pre-game projection.

whatWentRight.title: Matchup Exploited Perfectly
whatWentRight.description: Patriots' vulnerability to pass-catching RBs (6.11 rec/game allowed) materialized exactly as projected. White's 5 receptions fit the historical pattern of opposing backs exploiting this weakness.

whatWentRight.title: Game Script Alignment
whatWentRight.description: Patriots' 28-23 victory created negative game script forcing Tampa Bay into passing mode. Mayfield's 43 attempts (season-high) meant abundant opportunities for White in checkdown role.

whatWentRight.title: Irving Absence Impact
whatWentRight.description: With Irving out, White handled 100% of pass-catching back snaps. His 5 targets represented significant role expansion from season average, validating the injury analysis.

whatWentRight.title: Elite Execution
whatWentRight.description: White's 100% catch rate (5-for-5) showed reliable hands. Even with minimal yardage (16 yards), the volume materialized exactly as projected. This was about receptions, not yardage.

statisticalContext.vsPatriotsDefense: Patriots allowed 6.11 rec/game to RBs; White's 5 rec fit within expected range

closingLineValue.verdict: Strong positive CLV - line moved toward over as sharp money recognized matchup edge late. Market correctly valued Irving absence and Patriots' RB pass defense weakness.

keyTakeaways: Matchup-specific edges drive profitability: Patriots allowing 6.11 rec/game to RBs created clear value
Injury analysis matters: Irving's absence expanded White's role exactly as projected
Game script awareness: Patriots' dominance forced pass-heavy Tampa Bay offense (43 attempts)
+102 odds offered significant value - should have been -130 given pre-game circumstances
100% catch rate validated reliability in pass-catching role despite modest yardage
This is textbook profitable betting: identifying mispriced line where projection differs from market consensus
verdict: Perfect execution of matchup-based prop betting. When elite run defense meets worst pass-catching RB defense in negative game script, receptions props become high-probability plays.
